So there's a great
line that says

that sex is a disappointing
answer to life's riddle

and that love is ultimately
a religious problem.

What we hope to get with love is

Once we dispensed with God,
or once Nietzsche told us

35.58.text:
that God is dead, we needed
something else to believe in.

When in love, they
are like the wind.

What we really hope to gain

It's stepping off
that people mover

By merging with an
incarnation of the divine,

You know, the whole purpose

the self-creating
beings that we are,

We can sense the divine
